img.alt: Left Hand Brewing Company by Name Game IPA

img.alt: Left Hand Brewing Company by Introvert w/ Lemon

div.p: Stephen B. is drinking an Introvert w/ Lemon by Left Hand Brewing Company at Left Hand Brewing Company
Mighty tasty, has a great bitter finish reminiscent of lemon pithe and zest.
Juanito S.: Must fuel the robot
Stephen B.: Yes!

img.alt: Left Hand Brewing Company by Fade To Black, Vol. 1

div.p: Stephen B. is drinking a Fade To Black, Vol. 1 by Left Hand Brewing Company at Left Hand Brewing Company
Nice and tasty
James R.: #1? damn, how old is that?
Stephen B.: Actually, not that old. This was a 2015 edition. The different numbers signify a different style: imperial stout, brown porter, etc.

img.alt: Fort Collins Brewery (FCB) by Double Pom Tom's

div.p: Stephen B. is drinking a Double Pom Tom's by Fort Collins Brewery (FCB) at Fort Collins Brewery & Tavern
Now this is tasty...wheat ale with tons of pomegranate and some white peppercorn to balance

img.span: Earned the Keep Your Wits About You badge!

img.alt: Fort Collins Brewery (FCB) by Cup of Joe

div.p: Stephen B. is drinking a Cup of Joe by Fort Collins Brewery (FCB) at Fort Collins Brewery & Tavern
Almonds and vanilla finish...old ale base with amazing coffee. Taste like it's name.

img.alt: Fort Collins Brewery (FCB) by Breakfast of Champions

div.p: Stephen B. is drinking a Breakfast of Champions by Fort Collins Brewery (FCB) at Fort Collins Brewery & Tavern
Umm...bacon on the nose and on the finish...with a maple sweetness. Where are my pancakes to go with??

img.alt: Fort Collins Brewery (FCB) by Oldwyn's Wild Sister (Malt Monster Series)

div.p: Stephen B. is drinking an Oldwyn's Wild Sister (Malt Monster Series) by Fort Collins Brewery (FCB) at Fort Collins Brewery & Tavern
I liked this better than the reg oldwyne...the fruit goes better with the brett

img.alt: Fort Collins Brewery (FCB) by Oldwyn, Olde English Ale (Malt Monster Series)

Really good fruit sour...nicely balanced with the sweet and tart...reminds me of a warhead :-)

Stephen B. is drinking a Pump[KY]n (2015) by Avery Brewing Co. at Avery Brewing Company
I think this is my new favorite pumpkin beer. Nice spice and aged in KY bourbon barrels.

img.span: Earned the Sky's the Limit (Level 21) badge!
Earned the Gourd to the Last Drop (Level 3) badge!

div.p: Stephen B. is drinking a Rumpkin (2015) by Avery Brewing Co. at Avery Brewing Company
Pumpkin ale on steroids. Epically huge. A bit boozy, but perfect to warm you up in a snowstorm. Nice golden copper color.

img.alt: Avery Brewing Co. by Mephistopheles' Stout

div.p: Stephen B. is drinking a Mephistopheles' Stout by Avery Brewing Co. at Avery Brewing Company
Such a huge beer in a itty bitty glass...awesome stout.

img.span: Earned the Find the Source (Level 3) badge!

div.p: Stephen B. is drinking a Warsteiner Premium Dunkel by Warsteiner at Edelweiss German Restaurant
Mighty tasty...and goes well with my Ruben.

img.alt: König Ludwig Schlossbrauerei Kaltenberg by König Ludwig Weissbier Hell / Royal Bavarian Hefe-Weizen

div.p: Stephen B. is drinking a König Ludwig Weissbier Hell / Royal Bavarian Hefe-Weizen by König Ludwig Schlossbrauerei Kaltenberg at Edelweiss German Restaurant
This is how hefe's should taste.

img.alt: Sierra Nevada Brewing Co. by Terra Incognita (2014)

div.p: Stephen B. is drinking a Terra Incognita (2014) by Sierra Nevada Brewing Co. at South Fork
Imperial brown ale with a portion blended in wine barrels and bourbon barrels...pretty good. Wish I had another to age for another few years

img.alt: Crooked Stave Artisan Beer Project by Hop Savant Centennial

div.p: Stephen B. is drinking a Hop Savant Centennial by Crooked Stave Artisan Beer Project at South Fork
Out of the 3 renditions, I like this the most. The centennial hops ballance out the brett's sour funk and maintains the ipa backbone.

img.alt: Crooked Stave Artisan Beer Project by Hop Savant (Dry Hopped w/ Galaxy)

div.p: Stephen B. is drinking a Hop Savant (Dry Hopped w/ Galaxy) by Crooked Stave Artisan Beer Project at South Fork
This had the same sour funk backbone as the hop savant with citra...but the galaxy hops gave it an earthy tone.

img.alt: Crooked Stave Artisan Beer Project by Hop Savant (Citra)

div.p: Stephen B. is drinking a Hop Savant (Citra) by Crooked Stave Artisan Beer Project at South Fork
This was an interesting beer. Tons of sour funk, and the citra gave a piney, grapefruitish note.

img.span: Earned the I Believe in IPA! (Level 17) badge!

img.alt: Three Barrel Brewing Company by Peach Wheat

div.p: Stephen B. is drinking a Peach Wheat by Three Barrel Brewing Company at Three Barrel Brewing Co.
Fantastic low abv beer. Tons of peach on the nose and tongue.

div.p: Stephen B. is drinking a Dilley Incident by Three Barrel Brewing Company at Three Barrel Brewing Co.
This was an epically delicious imperial red. Bottom far right in photo.

img.alt: Stone Brewing by 20th Anniversary Encore Series: Stone 08.08.08 Vertical Epic Ale

Stephen B. is drinking an Old Courthouse by Boerne Brewery at 259 Brantley's Bistro

div.p: Stephen B. is drinking a Morimoto Soba Ale by Rogue Ales
